The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion
The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game)
The Lord of the Rings (film series)

wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==January==
* '''[[4 January|4]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Ken Jackson (4 January 1968)|a letter to Ken Jackson]].
* '''[[8 January|8]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] reads over ''[[The New Shadow]]'' and most likely starts typing a final typescript.
* '''[[29 January|29]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Ken Jackson (29 January 1968)|a letter to Ken Jackson]]. 
==February==
* '''[[5 February|5]]-[[9 February|9]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] is filmed for the documentary ''[[Tolkien in Oxford]]''.
* '''[[20 February|20]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 300]].
* '''[[29 February|29]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 301]].
==March==
* '''[[1 March|1]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Miss E. Byrne (1 March 1968)|a letter to Miss E. Byrne]].
* '''[[17 March|17]]''' - Author [[Nataša Tučev]] is born.
* '''[[20 March|20]]''' - Actor and stuntman [[Lawrence Makoare]] is born.
* '''[[21 March|21]]''' - Actor [[Greg Ellis]] is born.
* '''[[22 March|22]]''' - ''The Daily Telegraph'' publishes an interview of Charlotte and Denis Plimmer with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], in the article "[[The Man Who Understands Hobbits]]".
* '''[[25 March|25]]''' - [[Michael Reisz]] , who would voice [[Legolas]] in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game)|The Fellowship of the Ring]]'', is born.
* '''[[30 March|30]]''' – The documentary ''[[Tolkien in Oxford]]'' is aired on the [[BBC]].
* '''?''' - ''[[The Road Goes Ever On (book)|The Road Goes Ever On]]'' is published.
==April==
* '''[[15 April|15]]''' - Actor [[Richard Whiteside]] is born.
==May==
* '''[[2 May|2]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 302]].
* '''[[3 May|3]]''' - Author [[Michael D.C. Drout]] is born.
* '''[[6 May|6]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 303]].
* '''[[24 May|24]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to George Burke Johnston|a letter to George Burke Johnston]].
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Mary Fairburn (May 1968)|a letter to Mary Fairburn]].
* '''?''' - ''[[The Tolkien Relation]]'' is published.

==June==
* '''[[4 June|4]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 304]].
* '''[[17 June|17]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] falls down the stairs of [[76 Sandfield Road]] and breaks his leg.
* '''[[26 June|26]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 305]].
==July==
* '''Mid-July''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and [[Edith Tolkien|Edith]] move from [[76 Sandfield Road]] to [[Woodridings|Poole]], near [[Bournemouth]].
* '''[[24 July|24]]''' - Artist [[Colleen Doran]] is born.
==August==
* '''[[2 August|2]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Robert Havard|a letter to Robert Havard]].
* '''[[28 August|28]]''' - [[Billy Boyd]], who would play [[Peregrin Took]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]], is born.
* '''[[30 August|30]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 305a]].
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Ingrid Pridgeon|a letter to Ingrid Pridgeon]].
==September==
* '''[[4 September|4]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Mary Fairburn (4 September 1968)|a letter to Mary Fairburn]].
* '''[[29 September|29]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes a [[letter to Billy Callahan]].
* '''[[29 September|29]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes a [[letter to Margaret Carroux|letter to]] [[Margaret Carroux]].
* '''[[29 September|29]]''' - ''An Unexpected Party'', the first episode of the [[The Hobbit (1968 radio series)|1968 radio series of ''The Hobbit'']], is aired on [[BBC|BBC Radio]].
==October==
* '''[[6 October|6]]''' - ''Out of the Frying-pan into the Fire'', the second episode of the [[The Hobbit (1968 radio series)|1968 radio series of ''The Hobbit'']], is aired on [[BBC|BBC Radio]].
* '''[[9 October|9]]''' - Video game writer [[František Fuka]] is born.
* '''[[10 October|10]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Mary Fairburn (10 October 1968)|a letter to Mary Fairburn]].
* '''[[13 October|13]]''' - ''Riddles in the Dark'', the third episode of the [[The Hobbit (1968 radio series)|1968 radio series of ''The Hobbit'']], is aired on [[BBC|BBC Radio]]. [[Stanley Unwin]] dies.
* '''[[16 October|16]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Niall Hoskin|a letter to Niall Hoskin]].
* '''[[20 October|20]]''' - ''Strange Lodgings'', the fourth episode of the [[The Hobbit (1968 radio series)|1968 radio series of ''The Hobbit'']], is aired on [[BBC|BBC Radio]].
* '''[[27 October|27]]''' - ''Barrels out of Bond'', the fifth episode of the [[The Hobbit (1968 radio series)|1968 radio series of ''The Hobbit]]'', is aired on [[BBC|BBC Radio]].
* '''[[28 October|28]]''' - [[Stephen Hunter]], who would play [[Bombur]] in [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' (film series)]], is born.

==November==
* '''[[3 November|3]]''' - ''A Warm Welcome'', the sixth episode of the [[The Hobbit (1968 radio series)|1968 radio series of ''The Hobbit]]'', is aired on [[BBC|BBC Radio]].
* '''[[4 November|4]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Mary Fairburn (4 November 1968)|a letter to Mary Fairburn]].
* '''[[10 November|10]]''' - ''The Gathering of the Clouds'', the seventh episode of the [[The Hobbit (1968 radio series)|1968 radio series of ''The Hobbit]]'', is aired on [[BBC|BBC Radio]].
* '''[[14 November|14]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 307]].
* '''[[17 November|17]]''' - ''The Clouds Burst'', the eighth and last episode of the [[The Hobbit (1968 radio series)|1968 radio series of ''The Hobbit]]'', is aired on [[BBC|BBC Radio]].
* '''On or before [[29 November|29]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] has his secretary, [[Joy Hill]], compile a list of unpublished works that includes ''[[The End of Bovadium]]''.

==December==
* '''[[2 December|2]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Rayner Unwin (2 December 1968)|a letter]] to [[Rayner Unwin]], commenting that, though ''[[The End of Bovadium]]'' was on the list of unpublished works, he had "no intention of publishing" it to keep it from preventing him from working on ''[[The Silmarillion]]''.
* '''[[29 December|29]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 307a]].

==?==
* '''Late Summer''' - [[Tolkien Journal (Vol.3, No.3)|''Tolkien Journal'' (Vol.3, No.3)]] is published.
* '''?''' - Tolkien subscribes to an appeal for the restoration of the [[Sarehole Mill]].<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. lxxix</ref>
* '''?''' - After the death of his [[Stanley Unwin|father]], [[Rayner Unwin]] becomes chairman of [[Allen and Unwin]].
* '''?''' - [[The Tolkien Society of Sweden]], the first European [[Tolkien Societies|Tolkien society]], is founded.
* '''?''' - ''[[Tolkien and the Critics|Tolkien and the Critics: Essays on J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien#1960s|a letter to Mr David Masson]].
* '''?''' - [[Ken Rudolph Calendar 1969]] is released.

{{Years|1965|1966|1967|1968|1969|1970|1971|}}
